stories.original_title: MaliciousCorgi: AI Extensions send your code to China
stories.generated_headline: AI Security Breach: Malicious Extensions Leak Code to China
stories.summary: A new study reveals that certain AI-powered browser extensions, dubbed MaliciousCorgi, have been secretly transmitting sensitive code to servers in China, compromising user data and raising concerns about AI security.

stories.original_title: Actors: A Model of Concurrent Computation [pdf] (1985)
stories.generated_headline: Revisiting the Foundations of Concurrent Computation: The Enduring Legacy of Actors
stories.summary: This seminal 1985 paper introduces the Actors model, a fundamental framework for concurrent computation that remains influential in modern distributed systems and parallel processing. The model provides a mathematical framework for reasoning about concurrent systems and has shaped the development of actor-based programming languages.

stories.original_title: Clearspace (YC W23) Is Hiring an Applied Researcher (ML)
stories.generated_headline: Clearspace Advances Space Debris Removal with New Researcher Hire
stories.summary: Clearspace, a Y Combinator-backed startup, is seeking an applied researcher to enhance its machine learning capabilities for orbital debris removal.

stories.original_title: Towards a science of scaling agent systems: When and why agent systems work
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking the Secrets of Scalable Agent Systems: A Scientific Approach
stories.summary: Researchers explore the mysteries of agent systems, shedding light on when and why these complex systems succeed or fail, paving the way for more effective AI applications.

stories.original_title: Show HN: My Open Source Deep Research tools beats Google and I can Prove it
stories.generated_headline: Open-Source Research Tool Claims Superiority Over Google's Algorithms
stories.summary: A developer has introduced an open-source deep research tool, Project Lutum Veritas, claiming it outperforms Google's search algorithms, with evidence to support the claim. The tool's capabilities and potential impact on the search engine landscape are generating significant interest.

stories.original_title: My fast zero-allocation webserver using OxCaml
stories.generated_headline: OxCaml Web Server Achieves Zero-Allocation Performance
stories.summary: A developer showcases a high-performance web server built with OxCaml, highlighting its efficiency and speed. The server's architecture minimizes memory allocation for optimal results.

stories.original_title: Nano-vLLM: How a vLLM-style inference engine works
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking Efficiency: Nano-vLLM's Innovative Approach to Inference Engine Design
stories.summary: Nano-vLLM introduces a novel inference engine architecture that optimizes performance and scalability, offering a significant breakthrough in AI processing capabilities. This development has far-reaching implications for the future of AI deployment.

stories.original_title: Two kinds of AI users are emerging
stories.generated_headline: The Great Divide: Two Distinct Profiles of AI Adopters Take Shape
stories.summary: As AI adoption accelerates, users are splitting into two camps, each with distinct behaviors and expectations, reshaping the future of work and technology interactions.

stories.original_title: Show HN: NanoClaw – “Clawdbot” in 500 lines of TS with Apple container isolation
stories.generated_headline: Breakthrough in Compact Robotics: NanoClaw Redefines Autonomous Manipulation
stories.summary: NanoClaw, a 500-line TypeScript project, showcases a robotic arm's capabilities within Apple's container isolation, pushing boundaries in AI-driven robotics.

stories.original_title: My iPhone 16 Pro Max produces garbage output when running MLX LLMs
stories.generated_headline: iPhone 16 Pro Max Users Encounter Unexpected Performance Issues with MLX LLMs
stories.summary: A user reports subpar output quality when running MLX Large Language Models on their iPhone 16 Pro Max, raising questions about the device's capabilities.

stories.original_title: Microsoft is walking back Windows 11's AI overload
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Reverses Course on Windows 11 AI Features Amid User Backlash
stories.summary: Microsoft is scaling back its AI-powered features in Windows 11, responding to user concerns over intrusive AI elements and performance issues. The move signals a shift towards a more user-centric approach to AI integration.

stories.original_title: Claude Code is suddenly everywhere inside Microsoft
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Expands Internal Adoption of Anthropic's Claude Code Across Key Teams
stories.summary: Microsoft is encouraging thousands of employees, including non-developers, to use Claude Code for coding tasks, citing its ease of use and strong performance in internal pilots. The move reflects Microsoft's multi-model AI strategy and growing partnership with Anthropic.

stories.original_title: A Crisis comes to Wordle: Reusing old words
stories.generated_headline: Wordle's Lexical Limitations: The Consequences of Reusing Past Entries
stories.summary: Wordle's reuse of previous words has sparked debate among enthusiasts, raising questions about the game's long-term sustainability and linguistic diversity.

stories.original_title: MRI scans show exercise can make the brain look younger
stories.generated_headline: Exercise Linked to Younger-Looking Brain Structure in Adults
stories.summary: A new study using MRI scans reveals that regular exercise can contribute to a more youthful brain structure in adults, potentially mitigating age-related cognitive decline.

stories.original_title: Aging muscle stem cells shift from rapid repair to long-term survival
stories.generated_headline: Stem Cell Senescence: The Trade-Off Between Rapid Repair and Longevity
stories.summary: Researchers have discovered that aging muscle stem cells undergo a shift in priority from rapid tissue repair to long-term survival, revealing a complex trade-off between short-term functionality and cellular longevity. This finding has significant implications for the development of therapies targeting age-related muscle degeneration.

stories.original_title: Are we dismissing AI spend before the 6x lands? (2025)
stories.generated_headline: Rethinking AI Investment: The Overlooked Potential of Emerging Technologies
stories.summary: As AI capabilities continue to advance rapidly, industry leaders are reassessing their investment strategies, potentially overlooking the significant returns that future breakthroughs could bring. Experts warn that premature dismissal of AI spend could lead to missed opportunities.

stories.original_title: "Solving" Wordle from Shared Scores at 100%* Accuracy
stories.generated_headline: Researchers Achieve Perfect Accuracy in Retrospectively Solving Wordle Puzzles from Opponent's Score Shares
stories.summary: A novel approach leverages shared score patterns to reverse-engineer Wordle solutions with 100% accuracy, raising questions about online gaming security. This technique exploits the game's scoring system to deduce hidden words.
